column4: Does anyone have any ideas on how to completely disable graphical terminal in 9.10? The server I'm working on just shows a blank screen when it boots up (ubuntu-server netboot install).
disabel the gdm service.  if it exists..   but you are using the server edition?
I disabled "quiet" in grub, and it shows the stuff that quiet hides at the start of the boot process, but then the screen goes blank, even with recovery mode
perhaps use verbose, and nosplash, and nofb as options...
im not even sure if fb is the default any more
none of those options worked, but I know that the last thing that shows up is fsck, then a flash of what I think is setting console fonts
what video card is in that thing?
Intel Corporation Pineview Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 02
Hmm. other then nofb, nosplash, noquiet, verbose, im out of ideas... and disable gdm of course. but theres no gdm on a server install
can you still ssh into the server?
check what modules are loading..  (just a guess)
also try commenting that line you uncomented perhaps?
SmartSsa ardchoille: adding "blacklist i915" to /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf is enough to fix the blank screen problem
